page.title: 14FORESTRY
page.content: {FORESTRY}has been a feature of this district since the Forestry Commission started to plant Wauchope Forest in the years before World War Two. About 25 years ago the Forestry houses were built in our block,and operations were directed from an office in the village which closed due to re-organisation some two years ago.A tree nursey produces young plants to establish new forests elsewhere.At one time there were 26 forestry workers living in the village but now there are only 10-12. A lot of Forestry work has been taken over by private firms now.Most of the 8 000 hectares of Wauchope Forest are outside our block,and Forestry workers in the district can be asked to go further afield than previously.Wood is often sold to a contractor for felling.
